intro: Vilfa exilis, commonly known as the slender vilfa, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is characterized by its delicate, elongated stems and small, pale blue flowers that bloom during the short growing season. The plant has adapted to extreme conditions with a deep root system and a waxy leaf coating to reduce water loss. Its reproductive strategy involves wind pollination, which is common in its alpine habitat. Due to habitat loss and climate change, Vilfa exilis is considered a vulnerable species.
